bio:
FixThisBuildThat.com
▪️ Woodworking & DIY
▪️ @youbuiltthat: Plans & Reader Builds
▪️ @madeforprofit: Podcast
Win Gloves for a Year! 👇

posts.caption:
I just launched a new video on my Top 5 Uses for a Bandsaw. I put this new @jet.woodworking 14" bandsaw through some paces cutting up a bunch of wood. And one of my favorite uses is repurposing old scrap "firewood" like this walnut offcut. The JET's massive resaw ate this thing up quick and easy and I got some nice little boards, a few cool knotty panels and some turning blanks. Head over to the video (link in bio 👉 @fixthisbuildthat) to see all the other ways I use a bandsaw 👍👍
#sponsored #jetwoodworking #builtwithJET #fixthisbuildthat

Here's a #tbtd (throw back turkey day). This was 2 years ago when I built an outdoor coffee table, but what you don't see is just out of frame and behind the camera is my entire family (wife, kids, parents, plus an aunt and uncle) watching me put the concrete in the form. It was my first time working with concrete and it wasn't exactly what I'd call smooth going 😀. They were so worried for me and trying to give advice and of course I'm just trying to get the good shots for the video while I had no idea what I was doing. It was stressful, but fun to have them all in the shop watching and "helping". And every time I watch this vid I think of the people you can't see on the screen, my family. The people most important to me and the people who supported me to do what I love and take a plunge to leave my good paying job for a dream. Today I'm thankful for all the struggles, opportunities, and love that have shaped our lives and that I get to spend about 20 more hours a week with my kids than I did 2 years ago. Happy Thanksgiving!
#thankful #family #fixthisbuildthat

I've been using gloves from @firm_grip_gloves for a long time now and we've teamed to bring you a giveaway for a YEAR'S WORTH of their gloves to three lucky winners!
Now "a year's worth" is going to mean different things for different people and for me, I've been using the same pairs from them for over 6 months now. So we settled on 12 pairs, one for each month (not that most people should need to replace them that frequently). So it's a great opportunity to stock up on a bunch of different kinds of gloves like the 6 types I've got here in the shop.

Here's what to do:
- Go checkout @firm_grip_gloves if you aren't already
- Tag a few friends who need some gloves
- Head to fixthisbuildthat.com (link in bio ☝️) to enter the giveaway and get bonus entries

Ends Thursday 11/29 at 8:00pm CST. US and Canada only. Not affiliated with Instagram.
#firmgripgloves #sponsored #firmgrip #fixthisbuildthat

I love being able to repurpose wood into the sizes I want vs the sizes I have. Got these 6x6 cedar posts for free from a leftover job and I don't need 6x6s, but 2x6s would be just fine. Bzzzz...zippp....sawww. Ta-da! 3 2x6s 😀. I've got a video coming out on the ways I use a bandsaw and this is in it. Whose in the market for a bandsaw?
#resawing #bandsaw #fixthisbuildthat

Bookmatching figured wood is probably one of the coolest things you can do with a bandsaw. For my upcoming video I resawed a little piece of walnut that was right near a knot. Once you split it and glue it the figure looks amazing! I'm excited to share the whole vid with you guys tomorrow!
#figuredwood #bookmatching #fixthisbuildthat

Changing a bandsaw blade is kind of like wrestling an oiled up pig...with spikes on its back. But after you get the blade out folding it up is pretty easy. Just step on the bottom of the blade and turn your hand as you push down the top. Folds up into 3 nice little loops. And a binder clip makes a great holder too!
#quicktip #pigwrestling #fixthisbuildthat

Breaking out the router table for some picture frame molding details. Of course cast iron tops love to collect rust like I collect scrap wood. Noting a quick gray scotchbrite pad and some paste wax can't fix. This little surface rust comes off easily, just make sure it doesn't start pitting or then you've got much more work to do. How do you keep rust at bay?
#rusty #tools #fixthisbuildthat

I've never taken the time to make a sacrificial zero clearance fence for the miter saw...why did I wait this long? I'm doing a video for next week on a few different ways to make picture frames and this setup has been perfect for cutting clean miters. No splintering or tearout and I can use the surface to mark for the cuts taking the rabbets for the glass and picture into account. I know the majority of you said you make frames on the miter saw, but are you using a zero clearance fence? If not, you should try it!
#mitersaw #tricks #fixthisbuildthat

One of the ways I explored making picture frames for my upcoming vid was using just the tablesaw for profiling. You can make some pretty nice moldings with a few tilts of the blade. This is a very simple design and it looks great too. Are you a fancy frame kind of person with lots of moldings or do you like the simple looks?
#pictureframes #tablesaw #fixthisbuildthat

Splines, splines, everywhere there's splines. Who remembers 1990 when Tesla was a one-hit-wonder band and not an electric car? Anyways...cut some splines for one of the picture frames and it's a pretty process. Millenials I'm sorry to utterly confuse you. Just Google "Signs by Tesla" and you'll understand. GenX, who's with me? 😂😂
#splines #fixthisbuildthat

If you missed it yesterday I have a giveaway going on with @firm_grip_gloves for a year's worth of gloves! (link in bio to enter 👉 @fixthisbuildthat). The way I use gloves the most in the shop is for rough material breakdown. Call me a wimp, but if I can avoid getting splinters from rough lumber and taking the time to pull them out then I'm happy 😀. And after the lumber is smooth I go sans gloves for the safety around fast spinning blades. Head to the giveaway page to see my favorites gloves (including these Veil ones I'm wearing here) and get entered 👍.
#ad #firmgripgloves #fixthisbuildthat

I've never made a circle cutting jig so I figured I better see what all the fuss was about. In about 10 minutes I threw together this super basic version that would be good for circles up to about 8 inches for my bandsaw video (link in bio 👉 @fixthisbuildthat). All I used was a scrap of 3/4" ply, a pine runner, and a small nail. You don't always have to get all fancy to make jigs. Sometimes a down and dirty version gets it done. What's your go to circle cutting method?
#jigs #bandsaw
